newsitem.title: CANADA: Chretien says Quebec might join Team Canada.
newsitem.headline: Chretien says Quebec might join Team Canada.

text.p: Canadian Prime Minister said on Tuesday that Quebec Premier Lucien Bouchard might join the federal government's "Team Canada" trade mission to certain Asian countries in January.

"I am pleased that Premier Bouchard is giving serious consideration to being a participant in the next Team Canada mission this coming January to Thailand, Korea and the Philippines," Chretien said in a speech to the Chamber of Commerce of Metropolitan Montreal.
In his speech Chretien said the Canadian and Quebec governments must work together to revitalise the ailing economy of Montreal, Canada's second largest city.
Chretien said he and Bouchard had met and spoken "several times" about what they can do together for Montreal's economy.
Team Canada is a trade mission led Chretien and including provincial premiers and business executives. It has had successful missions to China, India and other Asian countries.

Bouchard's predecessor, Jacques Parizeau, refused to participate in the Team Canada missions even though several Quebec companies on the mission subsequently signed significant international trade contracts.
